page.description: Adds fields to a table. New_fields is a crlf list of fields to be added in format: fieldname,type,size,decimals

argument.name: new_field_list
argument.description: A CR-LF delimited string containing the name and definition of each new field to be added. Each field in Field_List is specified in the format: Fieldname, type, width, decimal_places. The field types, the single character codes used to represent them, and the valid parameters associated with them are:

item.name: Numeric
item.description: "N", Fieldname, Field Type, Width , Decimal Width

page.discussion: The TABLE.ADD_FIELDS() method adds new fields to an existing table. If Field_List contains a field name that is not unique, then the field name is adjusted so that it is unique. E.g. "name" becomes "name1" etc. All of the existing data in Table_Name is preserved when the new fields are added.

section.description: This script adds several new fields to an existing table.
section.example: fields = <<%str% Product,c,20 Price,n,10,2 Notes,m %str% table.add_fields("table1", fields)
